alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 4:54AM MDT until June 14 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. .High water levels will occur today and tonight. A gradual lowering of water levels will occur after Tuesday. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor to Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
